collect.database_saver module¶

class collect.database_saver.DatabaseSaver(logger)[source]¶

Bases: object

Сlass to save file information into a database.

logger¶

A logger instance for logging exceptions during database operations.

Type:

Logger

save_to_db(data, run_id)[source]¶

Saves a list of file information to the database.

Parameters:

  • data (list) – A list of dictionaries, where each dictionary contains metadata about a file.

  • run_id (int) – An identifier for the batch operation or run.

FileInfo Fields Saved:

  • name (str): File name.

  • path (str): Full path to the file.

  • size (int): File size in bytes.

  • extension (str): File extension (e.g., .txt, .pdf).

  • created_at (datetime): Aware datetime when the file was created.

  • modified_at (datetime): Aware datetime when the file was last modified.

  • width (int, optional): Width of the file (e.g., image/video).

  • height (int, optional): Height of the file (e.g., image/video).

  • area (int, optional): Area of the file content (if applicable).

  • dpi (int, optional): DPI (dots per inch) for images.

  • exif_data (str, optional): EXIF metadata for images.

  • pages (int, optional): Number of pages (for documents like PDFs).

  • format (str, optional): Format or standard (e.g., A4, A3 for documents).

  • orientation (str, optional): Orientation of the file (portrait or landscape).

  • run_id (int): Identifier for the processing run.

get_info(file)[source]¶

Extracts metadata and format details from file.

Parameters:

file (str) – Path to the .docx file.

Returns:

A dictionary containing metadata and format information, including:

  • author (str): Author of the document.

  • created (str): Creation timestamp of the document.

  • modified (str): Last modification timestamp.

  • last_printed (str): Timestamp of the last print event.

  • category (str): Document category.

  • pages (int): Estimated number of pages (count of paragraphs).

  • format (str): Page format (e.g., ‘A4’).

  • orientation (str): Page orientation (‘landscape’ or ‘portrait’).

Return type:

dict

get_orientation(section)[source]¶

Determines the orientation of a document section.

Parameters:

section (docx.section.Section) – A section object from the document.

Returns:

‘landscape’ if the section is in landscape orientation, otherwise ‘portrait’.

Return type:

str
